data.text: Set not thy heart upon thy goods:
Follow not thine own mind and thy strength,
And say not, Who shall controul me for my works?
Say not, I have sinned, and what harm hath happened unto me?
Concerning propitiation, be not without fear
And say not, His mercy is great;
Make no tarrying to turn to the Lord,
Set not thy heart upon goods unjustly gotten;
Be swift to hear; and let thy life be sincere;
If thou hast understanding, answer thy neighbour;
Honour and shame is in talk;
Be not called a whisperer, and lie not in wait with thy tongue:
Be not ignorant of any thing in a great matter or a small.
